cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-north-west tonight, then turning north-northeast on Thursday and accelerating northeastward along the Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the central South Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from northeast Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; peak sustained 35–45 kt with higher gusts Wednesday evening into early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level near and north of the Port of Brunswick at times of high tide, accompanied by large waves
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain producing 2–4 in., locally up to 6 in., capable of flash flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible along immediate Georgia coast; dangerous surf and rip currents
